Title: Matt Dotson's Global Toolkit
Description: The Global Toolkit provides jump start for developers working on international applications.  The source code should provide a framework which facilitates creating your own global applications.  It's developed in C#, but can be used in binary form in any .NET project.
HomeWiki:
Project Description
This project will will be the home for globalization related utility and framework code.

Feature Priority List
  • Currency class
  • Date/Time guidance and helper classes
  • String Localization helper classes
  • WCF Localization (WS-I18N implementation)
  • WPF Localization (alternate to locbaml)

FAQs
How do I get the code?
Download it from the "Source Code" tab.

What if I only want the binaries?
Download them from the "Releases" tab.

Can I use this code in my own projects?
Yes, the global toolkit is shared source. Make sure to read the license to understand the exact conditions.

How do I contribute?
Use the discussion tab, provide feedback and report bugs.

About Me
  • I'm a Senior Consultant @ Microsoft. You can find my blog @ http://blogs.msdn.com/mattdotson/
